executable.title: Lesion Map Refinement
executable.description: This is a CLI supporting module and it is supposed to not be used directly with a simple input image
executable.contributor: Antonio Carlos Senra Filho (University of Sao Paulo), Luiz Otavio Murta Junior (University of Sao Paulo)
executable.acknowledgements: This work was partially funded by CNPq grant 201871/2015-7/SWE and CAPES

image.name: lesionProbMap
image.label: Lesion Probability Map
image.description: A lesion map informing the probability of being a MS lesion. The output from Logistic Contrast Enhancement module could be used here.

image.name: wmMask
image.label: White Matter Mask
image.description: A lesion map informing the white matter in native space.

float.name: lesionThr
float.label: Lesion Threshold
float.description: Define the lesion threshold used in the probability map, i.e. the percentage of voxels that belongs to truly MS lesions. Example: l=0.01 means that only 1% of voxels are actual MS lesions. (0.01 < l < 0.99)

float.name: wmMatch
float.label: White Matter Lesion Match
float.description: Set the local neighborhood searching for label refinement step. This metric defines the percentage of white matter tissue that surounds the hyperintense lesions. Higher values defines a conservative segmentation.

integer.name: minimumSize
integer.label: Minimum Lesion Size
integer.description: Set the minimum lesion size adopted as a true lesion in the final lesion map. Units given in number of voxels.
